title: Best electric bike deals | Discounted ebikes you can buy now
content:
Electric bikes are by far the fastest-growing sector in cycling and for good reason.

Electric bikes, often referred to as e-bikes, span all disciplines of cycling – from trail-crushing eMTBs to electric cargo bikes, there’s an assisted bike for everyone.

The best electric bikes often feature powerful motors with integrated batteries in the downtube of the bike, though this isn’t the case for all.

We have scoured the web to find the best electric bike deals for all types of bikes and budgets.

Best electric bike deals

Whyte E-160 S – £6,399 £5,795 (save 10%)

Whyte

The E-160 is Whyte’s do-it-all electric trail bike with 150mm of rear suspension travel. We tested the higher tier E-160 RSX model, rating it four and a half stars, praising its calm and composed ride.

This model is specced with a 160mm RockShox ZEB and a Deluxe Select R shock, and uses Bosch’s Performance Line CX motor delivering 85Nm of power from a 750Wh Power Tube battery.

  • Buy the Whyte E-160 S with a 10% saving from Rutland Cycles

Trek Fetch+ 2 Cargo Bike – £4,500 £3,600 (save 20%)

Trek

The Fetch+ 2 has a claimed cargo capacity of 80 kg and is the most compact model in Trek’s electric cargo bike range.

The bike uses Bosch’s Performance Line CX motor with a 500Wh Bosch PowerTube battery integrated into the downtube.

  • Buy the Trek Fetch+ 2 with a 20% saving from Sigma Sports

Rad Power RadRhino 6 Plus – £1,229 £999 (save 18.7%)

Rad Power

The Rad Power RadRhino 6 features 26x4in fat tyres with full-cover mudguards protecting you from road spray.

The bike has a semi-integrated 672Wh battery in the downtube connected to a 250W hub motor in the rear wheel.

  • Buy the Rad Power RadRhino 6 with a 20.6% saving from Rad Power Bikes

Carrera Impel IM-1.1 – £1,099 £879.20 (save 20%)

Halfords

The Carrera Impel IM-1.1 is one of the cheapest electric bikes available in the UK, featuring an integrated 367Wh battery in the downtube and a Hyena 250W hub motor in the rear wheel.

It also has integrated front and rear lights with a claimed range of 20-25 miles.

  • Buy the Carrera Impel IM-1.1 with an 20% saving from Halfords

Orbea Rise M-LTD FS – £9,999 £6,999 (save 30%)

Orbea Bikes

The Rise is Orbea’s ‘lightweight’ electric mountain bike, using Shimano’s EP8-RS motor system and an integrated 360Wh battery.

We rated the lower spec Rise H-10 aluminium version four and a half stars, enjoying its efficient motor and smooth ride feel.

  • Buy the Orbea Rise M-LTD FS with an 30% saving from Sigma Sport

Aventon Pace 500.3 Step-Through – $1,799 $1,599 (save 11%)

Aventon

The Pace 500.3 Step-Through is an electric hybrid bike, with an integrated battery in the downtube powering a 500W motor in the rear hub, giving a claimed range of 60 miles.

The bike also features integrated lights, with the rear of the bike featuring indicators on either seat stay.

  • Buy the Aventon Pace 500.3 Step-Through with an 11% saving from Aventon

Merida eOne-Sixty 700 – £5,750 £3,999 (save 30%)

Merida

As the name would suggest, the eOne-Sixty has 160mm of travel front and rear. The bike features a Marzocchi Bomber Z1 e-bike-specific fork to provide front-end damping, while a Fox Float DPX2 is used in the frame.

The Merida uses a Shimano Steps EP8 motor connected to a 630Wh battery that’s integrated into the downtube.

  • Buy the Merida eOne-Sixty 700 with a 30% saving from Tredz

Niner RLT E9 RDO Gravel E-Bike – £5,899 £2,999 (save 49%)

Merlin Cycles

The Niner RLT E9 RDO Gravel E-Bike uses Bosch’s Performance Line CX motor and 500Wh Power Tube battery.

Niner has given the bike a Shimano GRX groupset, and the bike sits on 700x50c tyres for off-road capability.

  • Buy the Niner RLT E9 RDO Gravel E-Bike with 49% savings from Merlin Cycles
author: Nick Clark
